page.title: 04Shipley CofE Primary School.
page.content: It was founded in 1823 when Mrs. Sarah Andrews provided a school room and Master's house. In 1860 the Burrell family presented land for a girl's school. 1876 saw the construction of the present school building and formation of a mixed Primary School. Today it has 52 pupils (5-11 yrs) in 3 classes. Shipley School is supported by a PTA which has provided a swimming pool and a computer. It also organises an annual Summer Fete. Other support comes from the Horsham 'Sportsmobile' who organise games. Visits by the school have included combined week long visits with Coolham/Slinfold Schools. One essential feature is a weekly visit by the Vicar to take morning assembly.The 4th year leavers attend an area Leaver's Service in Chichester Cathedral.
